Package gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.segment

Class ERRParser

java.lang.Object
gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.segment.AbstractStructureParser
gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.segment.AbstractSegmentParser
gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.segment.ERRParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
StructureParser
@Produces(segment="ERR", resource=org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.OperationOutcome.class, extra=org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.MessageHeader.class) public class ERRParser extends AbstractSegmentParser
Parse an ERR segment into an OperationOutcome resource. If no OperationOutcome already exists for this message, a new one is created. One OperationOutcome.issue is created for each ERR segment. OperationOutcome.issue.location is set from ERR-2 OperationOutcome.issue.code is set from ERR-3 OperationOutcome.issue.severity is set from ERR-4 OperationOutcome.issue.detail is set from ERR-3 and ERR-5 OperationOutcome.issue.diagnostics is set from ERR-7 and ERR-8 if present.

    Construct the ERR Segment parser for the given MessageParser

  • Method Details

    • getFieldHandlers

      public List<FieldHandler> getFieldHandlers()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructureParser
      Subclasses must implement this method to get the field handlers. The list of field handers can be stored as a static member of the Parser class, and initialized once from a concrete instance of that class using initFieldHandlers.
      Specified by:
      getFieldHandlers in class AbstractStructureParser
      Returns:
      The list of Field Handlers

    • setup

      public org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IBaseResource setup()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructureParser
      Set up any resources that field handlers will use. Used during initialization of field handlers as well as during a normal parse operation. NOTE: Setup can look at previously parsed items to determine if there is any work to do in the context of the current message.
      Specified by:
      setup in class AbstractStructureParser
      Returns:
      the primary resource being created by this parser, or null if parsing in this context should do nothing.
